channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: XRP briefly hits $50 on Gemini as users suspect relisting 'price glitch'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Gemini is investigating the root cause behind the suspected price glitch.

item.title: Robinhood beats investors’ appeal in GameStop meme stock case
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The appeals court judge said Robinhood had the right to impose restrictions on meme trade purchases.

item.title: Pentagon forms ‘Task Force Lima’ to map generative AI for US defense
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Task Force Lima will look into how artificial intelligence can be used across the U.S. defense, including warfighting capabilities.

item.title: Telegram trading bots are hot, but don’t trust them for custody — Security firms
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: There are still too many unknowns over how various Telegram trading bots store private keys, blockchain security firms told Cointelegraph.

item.title: Argentine agency opens investigation into Worldcoin over biometric data
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The Agency for Access to Public Information in Argentina was the latest government body to investigate Worldcoin, with reports suggesting probes in Germany, France and Kenya.

item.title: SEC announces $24M settlement for case against Bittrex and its former CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The U.S. regulator filed a complaint in April claiming Bittrex and William Shihara operated an unregistered exchange, also separately charging Bittrex Global.

item.title: Anthropic cracks open the black box to see how AI comes up with the stuff it says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: The researchers were able to trace outputs to neural network nodes and show influence patterns through statistical analysis.

item.title: Aave DAO opens voting on proposals to reduce CRV exposure
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Aave tokenholders are voting on three proposals that could reshape the protocol’s exposure to the Curve DAO token.

item.title: Digital Currency Group files motion to dismiss Gemini lawsuit, claiming it’s a PR campaign
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Gemini’s complaint filed in July alleged DCG and Barry Silbert had made “false, misleading, and incomplete representations and omissions” related to Genesis and the Earn program.

item.title: 3 reasons why Ether price is still pinned below $1,900
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: PayPal’s stablecoin announcement and a handful of Ether ETF applications are bulls’ biggest hopes for a price trend reversal.

item.title: Cross-chain wallet BitKeep changes name to Bitget Wallet after acquisition
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The exchange follows the likes of Binance, KuCoin and OKX in running self-custody wallets parallel to CeFi operations.

item.title: Newly discovered Bitcoin wallet loophole let hackers steal $900K — SlowMist
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: A series of attacks drained the wallets of BTC users by exploiting a faulty random seed generation algorithm.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Binance invests $5M in Curve token as hacker partially returns funds
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Twenty-seven percent of the funds stolen in the July 30 exploit have yet to be returned.

item.title: Circle preps $1B war chest to deal with market threats from PayPal and others
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tristan Greene
item.description: Circle’s USDC stablecoin has dropped from $45 billion in circulation at the start of 2023 to just $26 billion as the summer winds down.

item.title: Dear crypto writers: No one wants to read your ChatGPT-generated trash
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: Opinion: If you used ChatGPT to write an article, do us all a favor and delete it. None of us want to read it.

item.title: Chinese police to crack down on crypto and deepfake AI
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The move comes as several prominent Chinese blockchain executives have been arrested this year.

item.title: Alex Mashinsky faces electronic monitoring while on bail, judge signs off on protective order
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Prosecutors and defense lawyers agreed to a bail modification having the former Celsius CEO under electronic monitoring and largely restricted from moving funds over $10,000.

item.title: Stablecoins could be key to upholding US dollar’s global reserve status: WSJ op-ed
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: In an opinion piece in The Wall Street Journal, Brian Brooks and Charles Calomiris claim that U.S. stablecoin legislation is crucial to redollarizing the world.

item.title: 13 developments that could kindle the public’s interest in the crypto industry
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph Innovation Circle
item.description: A combination of trends already underway and deliberate industry action could lead to crypto’s watershed moment in terms of public adoption.

item.title: US and China AI-tech standoff shows signs of spreading to other countries
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: The ongoing spat between the United States and China over emerging tech like AI continues as U.S. President Joe Biden restricts investments.

item.title: Ripple joins BIS cross-border payments task force
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The task force is a part of the Bank of International Settlements’ Committee on Payments and Market Infrastructure.

item.title: FTX debtors and UCC clash over asset control in restructuring
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: FTX strongly criticized the UCC’s pursuit of asset control, recommending that debtors allocate nearly $2.6 billion from cash reserves into short-term Treasurys.

item.title: AI Eye: Apple developing pocket AI, deep fake music deal, hypnotizing GPT-4
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Andrew Fenton
item.description: Apple developing AI to run locally on your phone, researchers ‘hypnotize’ GPT-4 to turn it evil, and Google negotiates a deep fake music deal.

item.title: Hashing It Out podcast: What does the future hold for BNB Chain?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elisha Owusu Akyaw
item.description: Arno Bauer, the senior solution architect at BNB Chain, denies the “Ethereum killer” tag in a discussion highlighting new BNB Chain updates.

item.title: India proposes AI-powered conversational payments system — RBI
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: India’s central bank said that there’s a potential for an AI system that would initiate transactions through a conversation.

item.title: US bank reveals $166M in crypto holdings: Q2 earnings report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: SoFi started offering crypto services even before becoming a bank, and its banking license might change how it hodls crypto.

item.title: India plans to use crypto tokens in upcoming native web browser
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The feature is envisaged as part of the country’s national web browser project.

item.title: Bitcoin hugs $29.5K into CPI as odds split over new US inflation spike
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin looks set to benefit little from the latest CPI figures, analysts warn, with fresh BTC price losses firmly on the cards.

item.title: France updates its crypto licensing regime to synchronize with MiCA
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The amendments will become obligatory starting Jan. 1, 2024, and must be taken into account in by applicants for enhanced DASP registration.
